question: The Consumer Protection Act, 1986 provides how many rights to the consumers?
explanation: The Consumer Protection Act, 1986 provides 6 rights to the consumers which are as follows: (1) Right to Safety, (2) Right to be Informed/Right to Representation, (3) Right to Choose, (4) Right to be Heard, (5) Right to seek redressal and (6) Right to consumer education.
